CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Expulsion) (Conditional) (Tajikistan);No violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-1 - Lawful arrest or detention);Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-4 - Speediness of review)
JUDGES: Alena Poláčková;Dmitry Dedov;Georgios A. Serghides;Helen Keller;Helena Jäderblom;Luis López Guerra
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE . He arrived in GPE in DATE . He travelled to NORP on a number of occasions to visit his parents for short periods of time .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was charged in absentia in NORP with participating in an extremist religious movement , ORG , and an international search and arrest warrant was issued in his name . On DATE the NORP authorities ordered his pre - trial detention .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested in GPE and detained . On DATE ORG of GPE ( “ the ORG ” ) ordered his detention pending extradition .

CARDINAL . On DATE the NORP prosecution authorities requested the applicant ’s extradition on the basis of the above charges . The request included assurances regarding his proper treatment , which were formulated in standard terms .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG extended the applicant ’s detention until DATE .
CARDINAL . An appeal by the applicant of DATE was dismissed by ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG again extended the applicant ’s detention until DATE .
CARDINAL . An appeal by the applicant of CARDINAL DATE was dismissed by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s extradition was refused by ORG , owing to the absence of culpable actions under NORP criminal law .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was released from detention .
CARDINAL . On DATE , immediately after his release , the applicant was rearrested for violating migration regulations .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found the applicant guilty of violating migration regulations , fined him and ordered his administrative removal . Allegations by the applicant regarding a real risk of ill - treatment were dismissed , and he was detained pending expulsion . ORG assessing the risks stated that “ [ CARDINAL claims of the representative ... are of a speculative nature and not confirmed by the case materials ”

CARDINAL . The above judgment was upheld on appeal by ORG on DATE . Claims by the applicant under LAW were dismissed with reference to ORG assessment of the case , which took into consideration “ ... the nature of the administrative offence , the character of the accused [ who was criminally convicted in GPE ] ...
CARDINAL . According to the latest submissions of his representative in DATE , the applicant was still in detention .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a request for refugee status , referring to persecution in NORP and a real risk of ill - treatment .

CARDINAL . On DATE his request was refused by a final administrative decision of the migration authorities . The applicant challenged that decision in the courts , referring , inter alia , to the risk of illtreatment .
CARDINAL . On DATE his appeals were dismissed by a final decision of ORG .
